contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox person | name = Loïc Leferme | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date|1970|8|28|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malo-les-Bains]]<ref name='mer'>{{cite news | last = Henry | first =Michel | coauthors = | title = La mer engloutit Leferme | work = Libération.fr | pages = | language = [[French language|French]] | publisher = | date = 12 April 2007 | url = http://www.liberation.fr/actualite/sports/246983.FR.php| accessdate =2007-04-12}}</ref> | death_date = {{Death date and age|2007|4|11|1970|8|28|df=y}} | death_place = [[Villefranche-sur-Mer]] | occupation = freediver | spouse = | parents = | children = 2 }} '''Loïc Leferme''' (28 August 1970–11 April 2007) was a [[France|French]] diver who was the world [[free diving]] record holder until 2 October 2005, when he was surpassed by [[Herbert Nitsch]].<ref name="record">[http://www.apneamania.com/code/worldrec_main.asp?typeID=howr&discID=4 History of World Records]</ref> Loic was also a founder of [[AIDA]] in 1990 with Roland Specker and Claude Chapuis in Nice. In 2002 he set the world free diving record without any breathing apparatus at 162 meters.<ref name="record" /> His first world record was 137 meters (1999).<ref name="record" /><ref>{{fr icon}} [http://www.humanite.presse.fr/journal/1999-07-24/1999-07-24-293614 Voici l’homme le plus profond au monde]</ref> On 30 October 2004, he extended his own world record to 171 meters in the no limits [[free-diving]] category.<ref name="record" /><ref>{{fr icon}} [http://archquo.nouvelobs.com/cgi/articles?ad=sport/20041030.FAP0168.html&host=http://permanent.nouvelobs.com/ Loïc Leferme bat le record du monde de plongée en apnée à 171 mètres de profondeur]</ref> The premier advocate of this type of freediving has come to be known as Chapuis Style Freediving. A complete system for learning to freedive was developed from his teachings by [[Marcus Greatwood]]. He died during a private training session in [[Villefranche-sur-Mer]] when his equipment failed and he did not reach the surface in time.{{Citation needed|date=March 2011}} He was in training for a planned record attempt in July 2007. ==See also== {{Portal|Underwater diving}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://loicleferme.fr/ Official website] {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2011}} {{Authority control|VIAF=10076635}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Leferme, Loic | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = french freediver | DATE OF BIRTH = 28 August 1970 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Malo-les-Bains]] | DATE OF DEATH = 11 April 2007 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Villefranche-sur-Mer]] }} {{Freediving}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Leferme, Loic}} [[Category:1970 births]] [[Category:2007 deaths]] [[Category:People from Dunkirk]] [[Category:Free-divers]] [[Category:French free-divers]] [[Category:Sport deaths in France]] [[Category:Underwater diving deaths]] {{Underwater-diving-bio-stub}}
